chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)
Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:46 PM
Defendant Alex M. Kasper appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Edmund Jelinski in court for Alex M. Kasper.  
Attorney Danuta Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin.
Statements by Atty. Jelinski.
Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.
Court questions defendant and advises of rights.
Court finds defendant waives his right to PH, finds probable cause exists, and binds matter over to 2575 for ARGN.
Proceed to ARGN today.
Information to be filed, mirroring complaint.
NG pleas entered.
Court accepts NG pleas.
Statements by defendant re: bond modification.
State opposes to bond modification.
The Court leaves the current bond in place at this time.
STC: contact Branch 2 for date.
Bond continued.
Further proceedings on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Further proceedings on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
